entry.title: ‚ÄúMore commonly, though, people are simply walking and rolling...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúMore commonly, though, people are simply walking and rolling down the city‚Äôs ‚Äúshared‚Äù streets with fewer threats from drivers of cars and trucks, who are supposed to steer clear of the corridors unless those streets are their final destination. The Department of Transportation and Infrastructure opened select streets to people and (mostly) closed them to cars this spring so Denverites could spread out at a time when close quarters might mean catching the bug. ‚Äú

Denverite

Petitioners are asking the mayor and his transportation department to make them permanent.

denverite.com

Shared streets and car-free parks will remain at least through the fall

Petitioners are asking the mayor and his transportation department to make them permanent.Petitioners are asking the mayor and his transportation department to make them permanent.

entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúThe Denver Department of Public Health & Environment‚Äôs Healthy Food for Denver‚Äôs Kids Commission announced this week it‚Äôs awarding nearly $6 million in grants to 25 organizations.

The grant awards ranged from just over $1 million that Denver Public Schools will use to build a greenhouse to $52,575 that Stedman Elementary will use to feed kids healthy snacks and for health and nutrition education activities in its garden.‚Äù

Denverite

The program is supposed to raise an estimated $11 million a year from a sales tax increase to fight hunger.

denverite.com

Hunger program Denver voters approved last year makes first round of grants

The program is supposed to raise an estimated $11 million a year from a sales tax increase to fight hunger.The program is supposed to raise an estimated $11 million a year from a sales tax increase to fight hunger.

entry.title: ‚ÄúThe lawsuit was filed in late May, as cases of coronavirus...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúThe lawsuit was filed in late May, as cases of coronavirus were rising substantially in the state‚Äôs correctional facilities. Hundreds of confirmed cases were tabulated each week and inmates or staffers at correctional facilities represented one in every five confirmed cases in Colorado at the time.‚Äù

The Colorado Sun

The Colorado chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union sought a lawsuit in May against the Colorado Department of Corrections

coloradosun.com

Colorado officials reach settlement over prison inmates vulnerable to coronavirus

The Colorado chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union sought a lawsuit in May against the Colorado Department of CorrectionsThe Colorado chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union sought a lawsuit in May against the Colorado Department of Corrections

entry.title: It‚Äôs all about the fine print‚Äî200 departures out of 17,000...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

It‚Äôs all about the fine print‚Äî200 departures out of 17,000 is hardly a story. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve let far too many bad apples rot for far too long.‚Äù

In the nearly two months since the governor signed Colorado‚Äôs wide-reaching police accountability bill in June, approximately 241 police officers in the state have resigned, retired or been fired.

coloradopolitics.com

Report: More than 200 Colorado officers leave profession after police accountability bill

In the nearly two months since the governor signed Colorado‚Äôs wide-reaching police accountability bill in June, approximately 241 police officers in the state have resigned, retired or been fired.In the nearly two months since the governor signed Colorado‚Äôs wide-reaching police accountability bill in June, approximately 241 police officers in the state have resigned, retired or been fired.

entry.title: ‚ÄúProtesters gathered in Denver Monday night hoping to draw...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúProtesters gathered in Denver Monday night hoping to draw attention to the police shooting of Jacob Blake in Wisconsin on Sunday.

Cellphone footage posted on social media Sunday appeared to show police shooting Blake multiple times in the back as he opened a door and leaned into an SUV. The state Department of Justice said officers were responding to a domestic incident, but it has not released more details. Blake was in serious condition Monday at a Milwaukee hospital.‚Äù

9NEWS (KUSA)

Jacob Blake was shot multiple times by police over the weekend. He is in serious condition.

9news.com

Gathering in Denver to pray for Black man shot by police in Wisconsin

Jacob Blake was shot multiple times by police over the weekend. He is in serious condition.Jacob Blake was shot multiple times by police over the weekend. He is in serious condition.

entry.title: ‚ÄúWe have to look at the proliferation of the use of ketamine...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúWe have to look at the proliferation of the use of ketamine throughout Colorado and we need to rein it in,‚Äù said Rep. Leslie Herod, a member of the Black Democratic Legislative Caucus.

Herod said her concern is medics acting outside of policy without repercussions for their actions.

‚ÄúThat needs to change,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúSo we will be looking at and addressing the use of ketamine in Colorado and hopefully we will have bipartisan and a broad base of support to move the effort for...ward.‚Äù

KUNC 91.5fm

entry.title: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want anybody to be surprised in our state when...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want anybody to be surprised in our state when classes, and even schools, do need to be shut down,‚Äù Polis said last week after visiting an elementary school in Aurora that has welcomed students back. ‚ÄúSchools are part of our society. They‚Äôre an important part of our society, but they‚Äôre not some exception to the rule that somehow is immune to what every other part of a society has to have.‚Äù

The Colorado Sun

Without a uniform state policy, it has been left up to Colorado‚Äôs 178 school districts to decide how to proceed during coronavirus. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want anybody to be surprised in our state when classes, and even schools, do need to be shut down,‚Äù Gov. Jared Polis said last week.

coloradosun.com

Colorado‚Äôs governor says people should expect coronavirus school closures as in-person learning resumes

Jared Polis said last week.Without a uniform state policy, it has been left up to Colorado‚Äôs 178 school districts to decide how to proceed during coronavirus. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want anybody to be surprised in our state when classes, and even schools, do need to be shut down,‚Äù Gov. entry.title: ‚ÄúBut as McClain‚Äôs story spread outside of Colorado, the...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúBut as McClain‚Äôs story spread outside of Colorado, the world learned bits and pieces about the person behind the name. That he was an animal lover who didn‚Äôt eat meat, a massage therapist, a self-professed introvert. He was a self-taught violinist who played for cats in animal shelters. He‚Äôs been described by people who knew him as a kind and gentle person, traits that were evident even in his last moments. His story has inspired string players across the country to stage candlelight violin vigils in his honor. And it‚Äôs moved countless creatives like Gordon to create tributes to McClain.‚Äù

Denverite

We spoke to 14 artists from all over the world, from Missouri to New Zealand, about the pieces they created to honor McClain.

denverite.com

A year after Elijah McClain‚Äôs encounter with Aurora police, artists around the world are still telling his story

We spoke to 14 artists from all over the world, from Missouri to New Zealand, about the pieces they created to honor McClain.We spoke to 14 artists from all over the world, from Missouri to New Zealand, about the pieces they created to honor McClain.

entry.title: ‚ÄúThe McClains are demanding the police officers and paramedics...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúThe McClains are demanding the police officers and paramedics involved in their loved one‚Äôs death be fired and arrested. And they aren‚Äôt speaking publicly until that happens. There‚Äôs nothing new to add, they say.

‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt gone through his belongings yet, I am waiting for a better frame of mind before I tackle the box his bloody clothes are in,‚Äù Sheneen McClain, Elijah‚Äôs mother, wrote on Facebook last week. ‚ÄúI need my energy for that and other motherly responsibilities, I can‚Äôt entertain the world, I‚Äôm not a celebrity y‚Äôall. I‚Äôm a mother mourning the death of her son. Murderers are free and nothing has stopped the rest of their gang yet.‚Äù

The Denver Post

Since his death nearly a year ago, Elijah McClain‚Äôs family and those who stood with them have watched rallies in honor of Elijah grow in attendance from a few dozen to several thousand. Community m‚Ä¶

denverpost.com

The world knows his name now: One year later, how Elijah McClain‚Äôs death impacted his friends and catalyzed a movement

Since his death nearly a year ago, Elijah McClain‚Äôs family and those who stood with them have watched rallies in honor of Elijah grow in attendance from a few dozen to several thousand. Community m‚Ä¶Since his death nearly a year ago, Elijah McClain‚Äôs family and those who stood with them have watched rallies in honor of Elijah grow in attendance from a few dozen to several thousand. Community m‚Ä¶

entry.title: ‚ÄúThey are suddenly thrust into the limelight, where they‚Äôre...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúThey are suddenly thrust into the limelight, where they‚Äôre suddenly expected to be a public spokesperson for all kinds of different causes when truly they‚Äôre a family grieving, mourning and trying to work toward some kind of healing,‚Äù Mari Newman, the McClain family‚Äôs attorney, told Denverite. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs incredibly difficult for any family who is grieving.‚Äù

Denverite

They met Saturday at Brother Jeff Fard‚Äôs Cultural Center.

denverite.com

The families of Breonna Taylor and Elijah McClain reckoned with the limelight alongside their grief together in Denver

They met Saturday at Brother Jeff Fard‚Äôs Cultural Center.They met Saturday at Brother Jeff Fard‚Äôs Cultural Center.

entry.title: ‚ÄúSpeakers called for divestment from CUPD, investment in...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúSpeakers called for divestment from CUPD, investment in mental health for BIPOC folx, increases in substantive and mandatory antiracism training for CU students, faculty and staff and increases in funding and support for BIPOC initiatives. By making these changes, conference organizer Roebke explained, ‚ÄúCU will finally be taking an overdue step to dismantling racist systems and (set) up their BIPOC community to thrive instead of only survive.‚Äù

Representative Herod voiced her support for the speakers, saying, ‚ÄúI believe that it‚Äôs incumbent upon us to listen, to hear what the youth have to say, to lift up their voices.‚Äù

CU Independent

University of Colorado faculty and students call for the university to divest in campus police and invest in Black, Indigenous and People of Color. By Mairead Brogan

cuindependent.com

Student and faculty leaders demand divestment from CUPD and investment in CU BIPOC

University of Colorado faculty and students call for the university to divest in campus police and invest in Black, Indigenous and People of Color. By Mairead BroganUniversity of Colorado faculty and students call for the university to divest in campus police and invest in Black, Indigenous and People of Color. By Mairead Brogan

entry.title: ‚ÄúOn Friday, the Denver Alliance for Street Health Response...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúOn Friday, the Denver Alliance for Street Health Response announced it‚Äôs been working with Aurora City Council members since January to discuss how they could bring such a program to the city. It‚Äôs modeled after the Crisis Assistance Helping Out on the Streets program in Eugene, Oregon. The goal of CAHOOT is to provide ‚Äúa more appropriate and more humane‚Äù approach to crisis intervention for people experiencing homelessness and mental health and substance use disorders.‚Äù

Denverite

The city is exploring a pilot program similar to Support Team Assisted Response, or STAR, in Denver.

denverite.com

Aurora could get a program like Denver‚Äôs that removes police from certain 911 calls

The city is exploring a pilot program similar to Support Team Assisted Response, or STAR, in Denver.The city is exploring a pilot program similar to Support Team Assisted Response, or STAR, in Denver.

entry.title: ‚ÄúThe tool is used in about two dozen Colorado counties,...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúThe tool is used in about two dozen Colorado counties, including Denver. And its apparent racial bias means Black people may be more likely to have to pay higher cash bail amounts, which judges use as an unspoken means to detain people they deem a threat to public safety. And for those who are released, the higher scores mean Black people may end up facing more strict pretrial supervision requirements, including regular check-ins, surveillance, curfews, and sobriety and drug tests. Failure to comply with such bond conditions can result in new charges and even jail time. ‚Äú

Colorado Newsline

A new study found that the most widely used bond risk assessment tool in Colorado courts scored Black people as riskier than white people.

coloradonewsline.com

Bias against Black people found in Colorado bail reform tool - Colorado Newsline

A new study found that the most widely used bond risk assessment tool in Colorado courts scored Black people as riskier than white people.A new study found that the most widely used bond risk assessment tool in Colorado courts scored Black people as riskier than white people.

entry.title: ‚ÄúProponents say the data, collected by the state‚Äôs court...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúProponents say the data, collected by the state‚Äôs court system, shows the policy is working exactly as it should and claim it‚Äôs the clearest indication yet that anxieties over rampant, improper usage of the law were overblown.‚Äù
The Colorado Sun

Denver County saw the highest number of red flag cases at 25. El Paso and Jefferson counties were tied for second with eight cases each.

coloradosun.com

Colorado‚Äôs red flag gun law was used 73 times in its first 7 months. Here‚Äôs how the rollout has gone.

Denver County saw the highest number of red flag cases at 25. El Paso and Jefferson counties were tied for second with eight cases each.Denver County saw the highest number of red flag cases at 25. El Paso and Jefferson counties were tied for second with eight cases each.

entry.title: ‚ÄúThis hospitalization data is another example of how...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúThis hospitalization data is another example of how historical inequities negatively impact health outcomes,‚Äù CDPHE Executive Director Jill Hunsaker Ryan said in a statement accompanying the data release. ‚ÄúThat fact is especially apparent during emergencies like the pandemic.‚Äù

The Colorado Sun

White Coloradans, meanwhile, are proportionately underrepresented in case counts, hospitalizations and deaths.

coloradosun.com

Hispanic, Black Coloradans have been disproportionately hospitalized because of coronavirus

White Coloradans, meanwhile, are proportionately underrepresented in case counts, hospitalizations and deaths.White Coloradans, meanwhile, are proportionately underrepresented in case counts, hospitalizations and deaths.

entry.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.‚Äù

- 5280 Magazine
